name: Christian Furr Biography
body:
Christian Furr


![](http://christianfurr.com//images/CHRISTIANFURR.jpg)

![](http://mmbiz.qpic.cn/mmbiz/bc0taIqJSDMKXSkJogBvsP9vCYUQIic7XgS2RIPIcKsCt718Cszibm2AUcESabhsEoic1VJxEWvu8G2J0QJtH8MGQ/640?&wxfrom=5&wx_lazy=1)
http://mmbiz.qpic.cn/mmbiz/WPic3cUsGEN9qB7ULP0Iqibu7ialHyvnfHFpJCrwCTnHvewSf2Mu4drlF6icjc5KUneQibhRcsAia47zvTic3BkwGNR1w/640?wx_fmt=jpeg&wxfrom=5&wx_lazy=1
Christian Furr

Appointed by the Queen in 1995 to become the youngest artist to officially paint the British monarchs portrait, when he was only 28 years old . The portrait was commissioned by the Royal Overseas League and hangs in their St James collection. Christian Furr has been invited by members of royalty and celebrities to paint their portraits, including the royal couple Thomas van Straubenzee and Lady Melissa Percy, American burlesque star Dita von Teese , Roman Catholic Cardinals and bishops and the late Saudi Crown Prince, Prince SultanBin Abdul Aziz al Saud.

In June 2004 at the House of Commons he was awarded  the Association of Colleges Gold Award (2004) in recognition of his outstanding contribution in the field of art . Former winners of the other British stars such as James Oliver , Betty Boothroyd and Jimmy Choo.

![](http://mmbiz.qpic.cn/mmbiz/WPic3cUsGENic5SQibzZH5S3S4QtichFbj1qSam16UPsejgBtfV3wNUC8u3ohR3NOW3EWPWrSdbBcVJr1BlzxXOsdA/640?wx_fmt=jpeg&wxfrom=5&wx_lazy=1)
HM Queen Elizabeth II 1995
Oil on Canvas
97cm x 71cm 

http://mmbiz.qpic.cn/mmbiz/WPic3cUsGENic5SQibzZH5S3S4QtichFbj1qwE3WFBuAES4oDtgmjbgWo0icglEDuKneYhAMG06xzP9Bhzu3tMKJO8Q/640?wx_fmt=jpeg&wxfrom=5&wx_lazy=1
Life's a Joke 2014
Oil on Canvas
110cm x 110cm 


His work has been displayed in the Saatchi Gallery, National Portrait Gallery, Royal Society of Portrait Painters and The Royal Watercolour Society. He is a member of Chelsea Arts Club, Hotel Cafe Royal, Groucho Club, Eccentric Club and the former Colony Room Soho. Furr's book The Lost Art was published in May 2008.

In 2013 Furr had a show of neon artworks created with the late Chris Bracey  entitled 'The Staying Alive Neon Collection'. The show received critical acclaim in the British press including The Independent.

In 2013 Furr was appointed to the board of the British Inspiration Awards In 2014 he was appointed to the Artists General Benevolent Institiution at the Royal Academy.  His work features in prominent collections globally including Hotel Café Royal and 45 PArk Lane - the Dorchester Collection, London

◤Published Works◢
"The Lost Art" John Blake Publishing Company 2007
"Take Art" John Blake Publishing Company 2008

◤Awards◢
2007 – Guest Speaker, London Best Learners Awards, House of Commons
2005 – MCCA Best Award- Robinsons Commission
2004 – AoC Gold Award, House of Commons
1991 – Elizabeth Greenshields Foundation Scholarship

◤Selected Commissions◢
2014 -Thomas and Melissa van Straubenzee
2013 – Dita Von Teese
2011 – Blenheim Palace painting, GE
2008 – HRH Crown Prince Sultan Bin Abdul Aziz
2005 – The Big Paint, Robinsons – Robinsons commissioned the artist to produce a commemorative work of Art featuring Tim Henman and Fred Perry for Wimbledon. The queuing public recreated the image on a giant 16ft x 9ft canvas at Wimbledon. ‘The Great Draw’ won The Best Award for ‘Best & Most Effective Long Term Communication Campaign’ at the MCCA Awards (Marketing Communications Consultants Association) 2006
2002 – Cardinal Cormac Murphy O’Connor, Westminster Cathedral
2002 – Bishops O’Donoghue & Stack, Westminster Cathedral
2002 – Sir Donald Irvine, President General Medical Council
2001 – Professor Robert Shaw, President RC of Gynaecologists and Obstetricians
2000 – Dr Robert Kendall OBE, President of the Royal College of Psychiatrists
1999 – John Dougill, Chief Executive; Institution of Structural Engineers
1998 – Roger Sainsbury MA F.Eng F.I.C.E President, Institution of Civil Engineers
1997 – Dr Lotte Newman CBE, FRCGP, President Royal College of General Practitioners
1997 – Noel and Leslie Botham; French House
1995 – Queen Elizabeth II; Royal OverSeas League
1993 – Maneck Dalal, Chairman; ROSL
1990 – Professor of Microbiology, Leicester University
